text: @FriedrichHayek In AI, the reality that needs to be discussed is everyday experience, like driving cars, flipping switches and changing light  bulbs. Once we mechanize this reality, going way beyond statistics, we hope to attend to grand scientific discoveries. Hopeless to start with the latter.

@pedrohcgs One would assume that the "credibility revolution" would change this educational misdirection. Why hasn't it? Ans. Because economists are still refusing the First Law of Causal Inference https://t.co/etASSEk4Or, leaving econ. education in want of foundation.

@RobertoCarlosF @achavito @wsosaescudero Stock and Watson's book was reviewed here  https://t.co/CEpVusa5eB. However, unlike authors of the other books reviewed, Stock and Watson consulted with me on possible improvements, and I assume their revised editions are free of inaccuracies.
